arm_group.description: single oral administration of 400mg of moxifloxacin
single oral administration of 400mg of placebo

brief_summary.textblock:
The Effect of Ethnic on Moxifloxacin Induced QT Interval Prolongation in Korean and Japanese
      Healthy Subjects

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Ethnic on Moxifloxacin Induced QT Interval Prolongation in Korean and Japanese Healthy Subjects

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to explore the ethnic and gender difference in the Moxifloxacin
      induced QT interval prolongation between Japanese and Korean subjects.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        - 1) Subjects in Japan and Korea deemed healthy as determined by no clinically significant
        deviation from normal in medical history, physical examination, ECGs, or clinical
        laboratory determinations.

        2) Body Mass Index (BMI) of 17.6 to 26.4 kg/m2, BMI = weight (kg)/ [height (m)]2.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  1) Evidence of organ dysfunction or any clinically significant deviation from normal
             in physical examination, vital signs, ECG or clinical laboratory determinations
             beyond what is consistent with the target population.

             2) Any of the following on 12-lead ECG prior to study drug administration, confirmed
             by repeat.

          -  Heart rate ≤ 45 bpmmsec or Heart rate ≥ 100 bpmmsec

          -  PR ≥ 210 msec

          -  QRS ≥ 120 msec

          -  QT ≥ 500 msec

          -  QTcF: male ≥ 450 msec, female ≥470msec

          -  Iincomplete right bundle branch block

          -  Marked Sinus Arrhythmia

          -  Wondering pacemaker

          -  Atrial rhythm

intervention.description: single oral administration of 400mg of moxifloxacin
single oral administration of 400mg of placebo

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Two-way Crossover Trial to Compare Moxifloxacin Induced QT Interval Prolongation in Japanese and Korean Healthy Subjects

primary_outcome.description: 12 point of ECG measurements according to the interventions

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Department of Pharmacology and Pharmacogenomics Research Center

secondary_outcome.measure: double delta QTcI, double delta QTcSS

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics/Dynamics Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
